thread.title: EXCLUSIVE: Aitor Karanka will be sacked if Middlesbrough don't perform against Man United
thread.title_full: EXCLUSIVE: Aitor Karanka will be sacked if Middlesbrough don't perform against Man United

title: EXCLUSIVE: Aitor Karanka will be sacked if Middlesbrough don't perform against Man United
text:
GETTY Aitor Karanka has struggled to turn Middlesbrough's form around 
Boro owner Steve Gibson is running out of patience with Karanka following a woeful run of results in 2017. 
The top flight strugglers have failed to win a league game since the middle of December to slump into the relegation zone. 
Boro are second from bottom of the table and three points adrift of safety with just 10 games remaining. 
Karanka’s men host United on Sunday and Starsport understands it could be his last game in charge. 
Gibson isn’t demanding that Boro beat United but wants to see proof that the players are still willing to fight for their boss. The Premier League clubs whose games involved the least goals (both scored and conceded) Sunday, 12th March 2017 MIDDLESBROUGH have been boring Premier League fans all season long with their lack of goals - but are they the most boring ever? 1 / 15 GETTY 15. Coventry 1993/94 - 2.1 goals per game 
Gibson has become fed up with the team’s lack of application under Karanka’s leadership. 
He is also worried about the Spaniard’s temperamental attitude towards his squad, which has seen him have several bust-ups with Stewart Downing creating an uncomfortable atmosphere in the dressing room. 
The Boro chief knows there is a two week international break after this weekend that provides him with time to find a replacement. 
Former Leicester bosses Nigel Pearson and Claudio Ranieri are on his radar, although luring the Italian tile winner to Teeside could prove difficult. 
Boro’s next three games after the international break are against fellow strugglers Hull, Swansea and mid-table Burnley and Gibson is keen to make a change if he needs to before it is too late. 
GETTY Karanka has been arguing with Stewart Downing 
GETTY Steve Gibson has lost patience with Karanka 
Karanka succeeded Tony Mowbray at the Riverside in 2013 and led Boro to promotion from the Championship last season. 
But Gibson was left fuming with him in January when Karanka hit out at club bosses for not backing him in the transfer market. 
The club signed Rudy Gestede from Aston Villa and Chelsea’s Patrick Bamford, but neither of them have been able to hold down regular places in Karanka’s starting XI.Gibson accepts Boro could have been more ambitious in the last transfer window. 
But he also knows he has funded the signing of more than 45 players since Karanka took charge, including landing the likes of established stars Adam Traore, Alvaro Negredo, Gaston Ramirez and Calum Chambers. 
Gibson reckons he has provided Karanka with enough talent to establish Boro as a mid-table outfit in the Premier League. 
The Spaniard has also been critical of fans this season. Related articles
